Reviews.Title: “Go to The Comfort Inn Cockatoo near LAX , spend the extra $20, well worth it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ASHLEY M
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked to stay here to two nights and decided to chek out at 5am after my first nights stay. Saying that the room was "newly remodeled" was an over statement to say the least. The Room decor was gross, the room smelled funky like old cigarettes even though it was a non-smoking room. The carpet was disgusting. If I was visually imparied I'd have assumed the carpet was moss due to the dampness of it. The bed was stiff and I actually checked the room and bed for bed bugs. The curtain covering the only window had a hole in it, that I was convinced was a bullet hole. We should have drove away as soon as I noticed pulling into the parking lot 2 men whom were already handcuffed getting ready to be taken away by a police officer. The door key also didn't work. I had to walk the whole length of the motel 2 times to get new keys to 2 different rooms since neither key worked. The only thing good about this motel was the bathroom was clean (even though it only had 1 towel for 2 guests and no shampoo or conditioner bottles, I'm surprised there was some cheap bar soap), had good water pressure and they refunded my 2nd night stay which I was billed for but never ended up using quickly. The only thing missing from this disgusting motel room was a chalk line of a dead body on the floor. Also their pool drains aren't split which means I hope your child doesn't get sucked to the pool bottom never to surface again. Spend and extra $20 and go to the Comfort Inn Cockatoo near LAX its beautiful and soooo worth he extra $20.

Reviews.Title: “An OK Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Motel 6 4 times this year and each time I have had no issues. Not the best Motel 6, but certainly not the worst. My brother has stayed in other motels in the SF Valley charging far more and they were a lot worse. There is security in the parking area, the WiFi has always worked. They have done a lot of fixing up this Motel 6. It is clean. Pool looked nice, and it was clean. As it is on the low end price wise for L.A., the folks are a mixed lot. No major complaints.

Reviews.Title: “worest motel 6!!!ripeed off!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn01186
Reviews.Content: no microwave no coffee machine no shampoo no blow dryer smallass room and it smells funny. it is not worth the 85 bucks at all.

Reviews.Title: “worst motel 6 I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: outta_here_suckers
Reviews.Content: The wifi does not work. The desk clerk argued with me and actually said "no, everybody is connected" without checking the router. He suggested I was the problem. There was only a third cup of coffee available and it was cold. The sliding security lock on our door is broken off. The pool is the size of a walk-in closet. The mini-fridge is very old. The cable TV is low-tier satellite with fewer channels than HD broadcast. The dresser is missing a drawer. The shower drain is clogged. But the water is very warm, I'll give it that. This is some old motel that must have bought a franchise because this was not built to be a motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “beware the rooster”
Reviews.Author: kyliep71
Reviews.Content: I just thought it would be courteous to other travellers to point out that this location is located next to either a farm or a house which keeps chickens and roosters. I discovered this fact when awoken by the sound of a rooster repeatedly from 4:30 am to the time I finally decided to finally check out at 7:30 am. If you're a heavy sleeper, have a good set of earplugs or just don't mind that kind of noise, then it's not a terrible experience. As other reviewers have noted, the area is kind of seedy and it's definitely in one of the ugliest parts of los angeles, but the rooms themselves are clean and the check-in staff are fine. But I can't see myself ever staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Boroko
Reviews.Content: As a Motel 6 fan, I was willing to discount the first night we stayed their as a fluke, or just "Saturday night at a city motel". However, on the second night the motel security guard's look of resignation (and fear?) made it clear to me the first night was no accident. The motel is well kept, and the service staff were friendly and provided good Motel 6 quality service, but it is in a very noisy location attracting a seedy crowd.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Unsure About this Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A basic motel at a cheap price. This Motel 6 is located less that a block from the 405, near the Budweiser Head Office. The hotel has a bit of a seedy feel to it so it may not be the best for families, although for couples looking for a cheap night sleep while passing through L.A. it might do the trick. There are a few restuarants nearby but that's about it. Not a place where I'd spent more than a night.

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 Los Angeles - Van Nuys/Sepulveda
HotelInfo.Address: 15711 Roscoe Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 91343
